page.title: 08 The Torpoint Ferry cont.2
page.content: -service in the late evening when the chain ferry stopped running. In the early 1920's the ferry service was taken over by Cornwall County Council. They ordered the building of 2 new ferries which came into service in 1925 and 1926. In 1932 a third ferry was brought and another set of chains were laid so that 2 ferries could operate simultaneously. Towards the end of the 1930's increasing amounts of traffic meant the plans had to be made for another set of chains to be laid so that a third ferry could operate, these plans were abandoned owing to the war. In 1960 the ferries that run today came into operation and chains were laid so that 3 ferries could run. In 1985 these ferries are wearing out and will soon need replacing. A 4th ferry is needed but will it come.
